intro: Myosotis paui, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a herbaceous perennial native to New Zealand. It features delicate blue to violet flowers with yellow centers, typically blooming in spring and summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream sides. Myosotis paui is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also significant in Māori culture.
